title: (RIOT plz) Zac query/problem
body:
Hi, i really enjoy playing Zac and only just started playing him recently, but one thing i noticed is that his Ultimate says "knocks up opponents" in the tooltip
when really it knocks them 'back' this really threw me the first few times as i ended up nocking enemies out of things like Orianna's ult or morganas Q
without knowing it was going to happen, Obviously i have adjusted now after the first game or two and just ignore the tooltip
but my question is why state that is a 'Knock up' when it is really a 'Knock back'?
to my understanding knock ups are like Yasuo's third Q or Zyra's R, moves that changes the enemy's position on the Y axis alone (vertically)
and knock backs are like Tristana's R and Lee sin's R which move the target on both X and Y axis (vertically and horizontally)

is this a wording error or am i just confused about the definitions?
if not either of those then what?

Thanks :)

replies.body:
I think you are probably correct - it does seem like a "knock back" instead of a "knock up". In terms of CC implications, they are the same:
http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Crowd_control

The only difference like you point out with be the movement in their X axis.

TBH there isn't really a Y axis, which is why you can flay Tristana while she is airborne during her jump.

As far as I recall their sued to be a Y axis, but it caused champions like Alistair to send enemies up in the air for a good 30s lol.
Also, you spelt airborne wrong ;)

Thanks, spelling is hard ;)

While there is visually a Y axis, it doesn't really have gameplay implications. For example,  a champion knocked up by Alistar can still be hit be other abilities (like flay) even though visually he looks like he is a mile above it.

Don't you dare even tell me I spelt used wrong, I see it and I'm not correcting it x) Indeed, I'm glad that was fixed though, I lost a few ranked games because of Alistair hitting a Kat up and we couldn't see her to hit her and she shredded our team for above. I laughed more than I should have on that matter though, wasn't even mad. But yeah, visually the Y axis is there, but it's actually not, per-say. It's an illusion! As for OP's question, it's not really a knock-up in fact Terra covered this so I won't repeat.

Yeah, that was for sure a bug (despite being pretty funny... haha).

Fun fact - although I'm not 100% sure if it is still true - When Vladimir is in his pool, his character model is just hanging out beneath the map (again, this is using the y-axis to visually achieve something, with no gameplay implications - except for this bug). I think there was a bug at one point where you could still cast Zhonyas in his pool, which would result in him not coming back up until it was done. This resulted in time where his pool was gone, but his character model wasn't translated back up to the map, so it was just like "where the *$#@ did Vlad go!?!?".
